label.crude.death.rates.statement: Population details from NCHS Bridged-Race Estimates are used to calculate Death Rates (per 100,000).
label.crude.brith.rates.statement: Population details from NCHS Bridged Race Estimates are used to calculate Birth Rates (per 100,000).
label.std.rates.statement: Population details from NCHS Bridged Race Estimates are used to calculate STD Rates (per 100,000).
label.tb.rates.statement: Population details from NCHS Bridged Race Estimates are used to calculate TB Rates (per 100,000).
label.hiv.aids.rates.statement: Population details from NCHS Bridged Race Estimates are used to calculate HIV/AIDS Rates (per 100,000).

label.help.text.year: This field indicates year of birth.
label.help.text.sex: This field indicates the sex of the child as recorded on the birth certificate.
label.help.text.month: This field indicates month of birth.
label.help.text.week.day: This field indicates weekday of birth.
label.help.text.gestational.age: This indicates range of weeks that represents the duration of the pregnancy at the time of birth.
label.help.text.prenatal.care: This field indicates the month in the pregnancy when prenatal care began.
label.help.text.birth.weight: The Birth Weight field indicates weight ranges for the child at birth.
label.help.text.birth.plurality: The Plurality field indicates if more than one infant shared the gestation and birth.
label.help.text.live.birth.order: This field indicates the mother's total number of live births, including this birth.
label.help.text.birth.place: This field indicates the place of birth.
label.help.text.delivery.method: This field indicates whether the baby was born by Cesarean section or vaginal birth.
label.help.text.medical.attendant: This field indicates the attendant (MD,DO,CNM) at the time of birth.
label.help.text.race: This field indicates the race of the mother.
label.help.text.ethnicity: This field indicates the Hispanic ethnicity of the mother.
label.help.text.marital.status: This field indicates the marital status of the mother as recorded on the birth certificate.
label.help.text.mother.one.year.age: This field indicates the 1-Year age group of the mother at the time of birth.
label.help.text.mother.five.year.age: This field indicates the 5-Year age group of the mother at the time of birth.
label.help.text.mother.education: This field indicates a range for the number of years of education received by the mother at the time of birth.
label.help.text.anemia: This field indicates whether anemia is reported as a maternal risk factor. These data are only available before year 2003.
label.help.text.cardiac.disease: This field indicates whether Cardiac (Heart) Disease is reported as a maternal risk factor. These data are only available before year 2003.
label.help.text.chronic.hypertension: This field indicates whether Chronic Hypertension Disease is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.pre.pregnancy.hypertensi: This field indicates whether Pre-pregnancy Hypertension Disease is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.gestational.hypertension: This field indicates whether Gestational Hypertension Disease is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.diabetes: This field indicates whether Diabetes is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.pre.pregnancy.diabetes: This field indicates whether Pre-pregnancy Diabetes is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.gestational.diabetes: This field indicates whether Gestational Diabetes is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.eclampsia: This field indicates whether Eclampsia is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.hydramnios.oligohydramni: This field indicates whether Hydramnios/Oligohydramnios is reported as a maternal risk factor. These data are only available before year 2003.
label.help.text.incomplete.cervix: This field indicates whether Incompetent Cervix is reported as a maternal risk factor. These data are only available before year 2003.
label.help.text.lung.disease: This field indicates whether Lung disease (acute or chronic) is reported as a maternal risk factor. These data are only available before year 2003.
label.help.text.pregnancy.hypertension: This field indicates whether Pregnancy-associated Hypertension is reported as a maternal risk factor.
label.help.text.tobacco.use: This field indicates whether tobacco use was reported during the pregnancy.
label.help.text.natality.state: This field indicates mother's legal residence recorded on the birth certificate.
label.help.text.bridged-race.year: This field indicates July 1st estimates for 2000 through last year of the series.
label.help.text.bridged-race.gender: This field indicates the gender of the population.
label.help.text.bridged-race.agegroup: This field contains values for age groups: under 1 year, 1-4 years, 5-year age groups for ages 5 years through 84 years, and 85 years and over.
label.help.text.bridged-race.race: This field contains values for the four bridged-race categories: American Indian or Alaskan Native, Asian or Pacific Islander, Black or African American, White.
label.help.text.bridged-race.ethnicity: This field indicates values of Ethnicities of the population.
label.help.text.bridged-race.state: This field indicates the State to be included in the data request.
label.help.text.bridged-race.region: This field indicates the Region to be included in the data request.
label.help.text.mortality.year: This field indicates the year of occurrence of death.
label.help.text.mortality.sex: This field indicates the sex of the deceased.
label.help.text.mortality.race: This field indicates the race of the deceased.
label.help.text.mortality.ethnicity: This field indicates the ethnicity of the deceased.
label.help.text.mortality.age: This field contains values for age or age range.
label.help.text.mortality.autopsy: This field indicates whether or not an autopsy was performed.
label.help.text.mortality.pod: This field indicates the place of death.
label.help.text.mortality.day: This field indicates the day of the week of occurrence of death.
label.help.text.mortality.month: This field indicates the month of occurrence of death.
label.help.text.mortality.ucd: This field indicates the underlying cause of death from the death certificate.  The disease or injury which initiated the train of morbid events leading directly to death, or the circumstances of the accident or violence which produced the fatal injury.
label.help.text.mortality.mcd: This field indicates the multiple causes of death from the death certificate. Multiple causes of death including not only the underlying cause but also immediate cause of death and all other intermediate and contributory conditions entered by the certifying physician.
label.help.text.mortality.state: This field indicates the person's place of legal residence at the time of death.
label.help.text.agegroup: This field indicates the age group of the patient.
label.prams.title: Pregnancy Risk Assessment
label.prams.filter.question: Question
label.prams.filter.maternal_age_grouping: Maternal Age- 18 to 44 years in groupings
label.brfss.title: Behavioral Risk Factors
label.brfss.select.question: Select Questions
label.brfss.update.question: Update Questions
label.brfss.filter.question: Question
label.help.text.prams.class: This field indicates that the Class by which the system indexes its variables for selection as the outcome variable in requested analyses.
label.help.text.prams.topic: Topics addressed in the PRAMS core questionnaire include barriers to and content of prenatal care, obstetric history, maternal use of alcohol and cigarettes, physical abuse, contraception, economic status, maternal stress, and early infant development and health status.
label.help.text.prams.year: This field indicates the Year for which PRAMS data is available.
label.help.text.prams.state: This field indicates the States for which PRAMS data is available.
label.help.text.prams.question: This field indicates the questions which were developed and tested and ultimately placed on the PRAMS questionnaire.
label.help.text.yrbs.year: This field indicates year of the Youth Risk Behavior Survey (YRBS).
label.help.text.yrbs.sex: This field indicates the sex of the students who participated in the YRBS National Survey.
label.help.text.yrbs.race.ethnicity: This field indicates the Race/Ethnicity of the students who participated in the YRBS National Survey.
label.help.text.yrbs.grade: This field indicates the grade of the students of the participating schools in the national survey.
label.help.text.yrbs.question: This field indicates the questions which were asked in the survey questionnaire. 'Students' refers to those who participated in the YRBS National Survey.
label.help.text.yrbs.state: This field indicates the State that participated in the YRBS National Survey.
label.help.text.question.tobacco.use: These questions contain summaries of survey data on tobacco use, including cigarette smoking, cigar smoking, and the use of smokeless tobacco.
label.help.text.question.unintentional.i: These questions contain summaries of survey data on behaviors that lead to intentional or unintentional injuries, including drinking and driving, violent behavior, weapons carrying, and suicide.
label.help.text.question.alcohol.other.d: These questions contain summaries of survey data on the use of alcohol, marijuana, and other drugs, including cocaine (powder, crack, or freebase forms), methamphetamines, ecstasy, inhalants, steroid pills/shots, prescription drugs, heroin, and intravenous drugs.
label.help.text.question.sexua.behaviors: These questions include summaries of survey data on behaviors that can lead to HIV and/or AIDS, other sexually transmitted diseases (STDs), and unintended pregnancies.
label.help.text.question.physical.activi: These questions contain summaries of survey data related to physical activity/inactivity, including vigorous exercise, involvement in physical education and organized sports, watching TV, and playing video/computer games.
label.help.text.question.obesity.overwei: These questions contain summaries of survey data on weight and obesity.
label.help.text.question.dietary.behavio: These questions contain summaries of survey data on dietary behaviors,nutrition, and fat intake.
label.help.text.question.other.health.to: These questions contain summaries of survey data related to a question on asthma.
label.help.text.infant_age_at_death: This field indicates the age of infant at death.
label.help.text.infantmort.year: This field indicates year of death.
label.help.text.infantmort.age.death: This field indicates the age of infant at death.
label.help.text.infantmort.ucd: This field represents the underlying cause of death from the death certificate.
label.help.text.tb.state: This field indicates the State where the TB surveillance data are collected.
label.help.text.tb.race: This field indicates the race/ethnicity of the patient.
label.help.text.tb.sex: This field indicates the sex of the patient at birth.
label.help.text.tb.year: This field indicates year of diagnosis or death.
label.help.text.state: This field indicates mother's legal residence at the time of birth.
label.help.text.tb.countryOfBirth: This field indicates the country of birth of the patient
label.help.text.infantmort.sex: This field indicates the sex of the child as recorded on the birth certificate.
label.help.text.infantmort.age.group: This field indicates the age group of the mother at the time of birth.
label.help.text.gestational.group.one: This indicates range of weeks that represents the duration of the pregnancy at the time of birth.  10 age groups: Under 20 weeks; 20-27 weeks; 28-31 weeks; 32-35 weeks; 36 weeks; 37-39 weeks; 40 weeks; 41 weeks; 42 weeks or more; Unknown.
label.help.text.gestational.group.two: This indicates range of weeks that represents the duration of the pregnancy at the time of birth.  11 age groups: Under 20 weeks; 20-27 weeks; 28-31 weeks; 32-33 weeks; 34-36 weeks; 37-38 weeks; 39 weeks, 40 weeks; 41 weeks; 42 or more weeks; Unknown.
label.help.text.gestational.weekly: This indicates range of weeks that represents the duration of the pregnancy at the time of birth.  Weekly age groups: 17 weeks through 47 weeks; Unknown.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.adequacy: This field indicates the state and quality of Prenatal Care.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.weight: This field indicates the birth weight of the baby.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.income: This field indicates the yearly total household income before taxes.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.marital: This field indicates the marital status of the mother.
label.help.text.crude.rate: Crude Rates are expressed as the number of deaths reported each calendar year per 100,000 population. (Crude Rate = Count / Population * 100,000).
label.help.text.age.adjusted.rate: Age-adjusted death rates are weighted averages of the age-specific death rates, where the weights represent a fixed population by age.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.age.one: This field indicates the mother's age: Age < 18, Age 18 - 24, Age 25 - 29, Age 30 - 44, Age 45+
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.age.two: This field indicates the mother's age: Age 18-44.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.age.thre: This field indicates the mother's age: <20, 20-29, 30+ yrs.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.age.four: This field indicates the mother's age: <20 yrs, 20-24yrs, 25-34yrs, 35+ yrs.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.edu: This field indicates the number of years of mother’s education.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.race: This field indicates the mother's race/ethnicity.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.medicaid: This field indicates whether or not the mother was a Medicaid recipient.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.hispanic: This field indicates whether the mother indicates that she is of Hispanic origin.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.births: This field indicates the number of previous live births prior to the index birth for this survey.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.wic: This field indicates whether or not the mother received benefits from the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) during this pregnancy.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.intend: This field indicates whether or not this pregnancy was intended as assessed by...
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.smoked.b: This field indicates whether or not the mother was a smoker 3 months prior to before pregnancy.
label.help.text.prams.breakouts.smoked.l: This field indicates whether or not the mother was a smoker during pregnancy.
label.help.text.rates: Crude Rates are expressed as the number of deaths reported each calendar year per 100,000 population. (Crude Rate = Count / Population * 100,000).
label.help.text.deaths: The death counts in the data represent deaths that occurred in the 50 United States and the District of Columbia, for the legal place of residence of the decedent.
label.help.text.pop: The population estimates are bridged-race estimates based on Bureau of the Census estimates of total U.S., State, and county resident populations.
label.std.help.text.year: This field indicates year of diagnosis or death.
label.std.help.text.disease: This field indicates the type of sexually transmitted disease.
label.std.help.text.state: This field indicates the State where the STD surveillance data are collected.
label.std.help.text.sex: This field indicates the current sex of the patient.
label.std.help.text.race.ethnicity: This field indicates the Race/Ethnicity of the patient.
label.std.help.text.age.group: This field indicates the age group of the patient.
label.std.national.data.available.for.fe: National data are not available for any disease for the years 2007-2010.
label.help.text.disease: This field indicates diagnosis and prevalence of deaths of AIDS/HIV.
label.help.text.hiv.year: This field indicates year of diagnosis or death. For persons living with diagnosed HIV, year refers to the end of the queried calendar year.
label.help.text.hiv.agegroup: This field indicates the age group of the patient. HIV surveillance data include adults and adolescents only (persons aged 13 years and older).
label.help.text.transmission: This field indicates the classification of cases that summarizes a person's possible HIV risk factor.
label.births.family.dsc: Browse detailed information on birth counts and over 250 maternal and child health indicators and risk factors
label.mortality.dsc: Browse detailed information regarding adult and fetal deaths in the United States, across groupings of race, gender and age.
label.health.risk.dsc: Use information on insurance coverage, disability, fertility and other health issues to draw conclusions about the nation's overall well-being.
label.disease.dsc: Review comprehensive information on risk behaviors, preventive care practices, and the burden of chronic diseases.
label.yrbs.dsc: Consider data collected from middle school and high school surveys to gain insight into national, state and local youth risk behaviors.
label.brfs.dsc: Collection of data from a state-based surveillance system in all 50 states and the District of Columbia for information on health risk behaviors, clinical preventive health practices, and health care access, primarily related to chronic disease and injury.
label.demographics.dsc: Population estimates are provided for use as denominator data in vital rate calculations
label.bridged.race.dsc: Based on Census estimates of U.S national, state and county residents, examine populations across factors including age, race and ethnicity.
label.open.access.dsc: Compare and analyze data grouped by sex, race/ethnicity, and age to identify and demonstrate important health differences between women and men and girls and boys.
label.aids.dsc: Learn about reported cases of AIDS and the corresponding response of health departments across the country. View information on survival rates and risk factors that contributed to AIDS-related deaths.
label.cancer.dsc: Compare cancer incidence and death statistics across ages, race, gender and year, as well as by cancer centers across the country.
label.cancer_mortality.dsc: Compare cancer death statistics across ages, race, gender and year, as well as by cancer centers across the country.
label.prams.dsc: Collection of data available by state and year for a variety of risk factors, such as physical abuse, breastfeeding, and pregnancy intention.
label.natality.dsc: Explore information regarding births across the country, including trends and data based on maternal education, socioeconomic background and risk factors.
label.std.dsc: Search STD case reports for women in order to gain insight on disease incidence rates, the number of cases reported, and which STDs most commonly affect women.
label.tb.dsc: Browse information on reported cases of TB across the country and how it impacts specific states.
label.mortality.dsc.two: Browse detailed information regarding mortality and population counts in the United States, across groupings of race, gender and age. Data are based on death certificates for U.S residents.
label.infant.mortality.dsc: View meaningful statistics on infant mortality and the various factors, such as maternal ethnicity and county of residence, that can potentially contribute to such an occurrence.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.year: This field indicates the year of diagnosis.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.sex: This field indicates the sex of the patient.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.race: This field indicates the race of the patient.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.hispani: This field indicates the ethnicity of the patient.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.age_gro: This field indicates the age group of the patient.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.cancer_: This field indicates the primary cancer site that is the organ of origin within the body where a given cancer occurs in an individual.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.childho: This field indicates the childhood cancer that are usually studied in children who are less than age 20.
label.help.text.cancer_incidence.state: This field indicates the State of patient's residence at the time the case was submitted to the registry.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.year: This field indicates the year of death.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.sex: This field indicates the sex of the deceased.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.race: Race This field indicates the race of the deceased.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.hispani: Ethnicity This field indicates the ethnicity of the deceased.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.age_gro: Age Group This field indicates the age group of the deceased.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.cancer_: This field indicates the primary cancer site that is the organ of origin within the body where a given cancer occurs in an individual.
label.help.text.cancer_mortality.state: State This field indicates the State of patient's residence at the time the case was submitted to the registry.
label.survey.data.not.available: Survey data are not available for the selected year
datadoc.datasource.deaths: The Detailed Mortality data are compiled from data provided by the 57 vital statistics jurisdictions through the Vital Statistics Cooperative; the data set is produced by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (US DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS), Division of Vital Statistics (DVS), Mortality Statistics Branch.
datadoc.citation.deaths: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.deaths: The mortality data are based on information from all death certificates filed in the fifty states and the District of Columbia. Mortality data from the death certificates are coded by the states and provided to NCHS through the Vital Statistics Cooperative Program or coded by NCHS from copies of the original death certificates provided to NCHS by the State registration Offices. Vital statistics data are suppressed due to confidentiality constraints, in order to protect personal privacy.
datadoc.datasource.mental_health: US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention and Health Promotion (NCCDPHP), Adolescent and School Health (ASH).
datadoc.citation.mental_health: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.mental_health: The YRBS includes national, state, territorial, tribal government, and local school-based surveys of representative samples of 9th through 12th grade students. These surveys are conducted every two years, usually during the spring semester. The national survey, conducted by CDC, provides data representative of 9th through 12th grade students in public and private schools in the United States. The state, territorial, tribal government, and local surveys, conducted by departments of health and education, provide data representative of mostly public high school students in each jurisdiction.
datadoc.datasource.natality: The Natality data set is provided by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (US DHHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS).
datadoc.citation.natality: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.natality: This dataset has counts and rates of births occurring within the United States to U.S. residents. States are defined by the mother's place of residence recorded on the birth certificate. Data elements include demographics, and maternal risk factors. As of May 23, 2011, all sub-national data representing zero to nine (0-9) births are suppressed. Population is Live births in the United States, 1995-2015.
datadoc.datasource.brfss: The Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System data are published by the United States Department of Health and Human Services ( HHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention and Health Promotion (NCCDPHP), Division of Adult and Community Health, Behavioral Surveillance Branch.
datadoc.citation.brfss: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.brfss: BRFSS is used to collect prevalence data among adult U.S. residents regarding their risk behaviors and preventive health practices that can affect their health status. Respondent data are forwarded to CDC to be aggregated for each state, returned with standard tabulations, and published at year's end by each state. In 2011, more than 500,000 interviews were conducted in the states, the District of Columbia, and participating U.S. territories and other geographic areas.
datadoc.datasource.prams: PRAMSTAT - Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System (PRAMS) Statistics is produced by the United States Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention and Health Promotion (NCCDPHP), Division of Reproductive Health (DRH).
datadocs.prams.advance.search.announceme: PRAMS data from 2012-2014 are being updated during the week of 08/27/2018. Advanced search with updated data will be available coming weeks
datadoc.citation.prams: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.prams: Pregnancy Risk Assessment Monitoring System is a joint research project between the state departments of health and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Division of Reproductive Health. PRAMS collects state-specific, population-based data on maternal attitudes and experiences before, during, and shortly after pregnancy. PRAMS surveillance currently covers about 83% of all U.S. births. These data can be used to identify groups of women and infants at high risk for health problems, to monitor changes in health status, and to measure progress towards goals in improving the health of mothers and infants. PRAMS data are used by researchers to investigate emerging issues in the field of reproductive health and by state and local governments to plan and review programs and policies aimed at reducing health problems among mothers and babies.
datadoc.datasource.infant_mortality: The Linked Birth/Infant Death Records data are compiled from data provided by the 57 vital statistics jurisdictions through the Vital Statistics Cooperative; the data are produced by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center For Health Statistics (NCHS).
datadoc.citation.infant_mortality: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.infant_mortality: This data collection provides counts and rates for deaths of children under 1 year of age, occurring within the United States to U.S. residents. Data are available by state of mother's residence, child's age, underlying cause of death, gender, birth weight, birth plurality, birth order, gestational age at birth, period of prenatal care, maternal race and ethnicity, maternal age, maternal education and marital status. The term "Suppressed" replaces sub-national death counts, births counts and death rates, when the figure represents zero to nine (0-9) persons.
datadoc.datasource.aids: CDC collects, analyzes, and disseminates surveillance data on diagnoses of HIV infection; these data are the nation's source of information on HIV in the United States. Numbers and rates and presented based on the date of diagnosis of HIV infection and infection classified as stage 3 (AIDS) (from the beginning of the epidemic through December 31, 2015; reported as of June 30, 2016).
datadoc.citation.aids: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.aids: These data are the nation's source of information on HIV in the United States. Numbers and rates and presented based on the date of diagnosis of HIV infection and infection classified as stage 3 (AIDS) (from the beginning of the epidemic through December 31, 2015; reported as of June 30, 2016). Data on diagnoses of HIV infection should be interpreted with caution. Data may not be representative of all persons with HIV because not all infected persons have been tested. Also, many states offer anonymous testing; the results of anonymous tests are not reported to the confidential name-based HIV registries of state and local health departments.
datadoc.datasource.tb: The CDC collects, analyzes, and disseminates surveillance data on newly reported cases of tuberculosis (TB) disease in the United States. The Atlas presents TB case report data submitted from all 50 states, the District of Columbia for the years 2000 to 2015.
Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.tb: TB data are presented by year of disease confirmation, reporting area (state), age group, race/ethnicity, sex, and whether or not the patient was born in the United States. The most common site of infection is the lung, but other organs may be involved. Nationally notifiable TB surveillance data are collected and compiled from reports sent to CDC’s Division of TB Elimination by the TB control programs and health departments in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, U.S. dependencies and possessions, and independent nations in free association with the United States. TB data can be viewed in aggregate format or one-way stratifications (i.e., by age group, sex, race/ethnicity, or country of birth [U.S.-born or foreign-born]).
datadoc.datasource.std: The CDC collects, analyzes, and disseminates surveillance data on STD diagnoses. The NCHHSTP AtlasPlus presents chlamydia, gonorrhea, congenital syphilis, and primary and secondary syphilis case report data submitted from all 50 states, the District of Columbia for the years 2000 to 2015 and early latent syphilis case report data for 2003-2015. STD data are presented by disease, year of diagnosis, reporting area (state), age group, race/ethnicity, and sex.
datadoc.citation.std: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.std: STD morbidity data presented in this report are compiled from a combination of data reported on standardized hard copy reporting forms and electronic data received through the National Electronic Telecommunications System for Surveillance (NETSS) for diagnosis years 2000 through 2015.For STD data, the data suppression rule is applied when the numerator for a given state is 3 or less. When suppressed, data are only displayed by state totals and breakdown by demographic characteristics is not permitted.
datadoc.datasource.cancer_mortality: The United States Cancer Statistics (USCS) are the official federal statistics on cancer incidence from registries having high-quality data and cancer mortality statistics for 50 states and the District of Columbia. USCS are produced by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI), in collaboration with the North American Association of Central Cancer Registries (NAACCR). Data are provided by The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention National Program of Cancer Registries (NPCR) and/or The National Cancer Institute Surveillance, Epidemiology and End Results (SEER) program.
datadoc.citation.cancer_mortality: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.cancer_mortality: Cancer incidence data are collected from cancer registries, based on oncology reports from health care providers. Cancer mortality data are derived from death certificates. Cancer incidence and death counts, rates, mortality incidence rate ratios and 95% confidence intervals are available by state, metropolitan area, cancer classification, age, race, and gender. Charts and maps are also available. The data are updated annually. Cancer incidence and mortality data are available for the United States, state by age group, race, ethnicity, gender and cancer site for the years 2000- 2015.
datadoc.datasource.cancer_incidence: The United States Cancer Statistics (USCS) are the official federal statistics on cancer incidence from registries having high-quality data and cancer mortality statistics for 50 states and the District of Columbia. USCS are produced by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI), in collaboration with the North American Association of Central Cancer Registries (NAACCR). Data are provided by The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention National Program of Cancer Registries (NPCR) and/or The National Cancer Institute Surveillance, Epidemiology and End Results (SEER) program.
datadoc.citation.cancer_incidence: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.cancer_incidence: Cancer incidence data are collected from cancer registries, based on oncology reports from health care providers. Cancer mortality data are derived from death certificates. Cancer incidence and death counts, rates, mortality incidence rate ratios and 95% confidence intervals are available by state, metropolitan area, cancer classification, age, race, and gender. Charts and maps are also available. The data are updated annually. Cancer incidence and mortality data are available for the United States, state by age group, race, ethnicity, gender and cancer site for the years 2000- 2015.
datadoc.datasource.bridge_race: United States Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS), Bridged-Race Population Estimates, United States July 1st resident population by state, age, sex, bridged-race, and Hispanic origin. Compiled from revised bridged-race 2000-2009 intercensal population estimates (released by NCHS on 10/26/2012); and bridged-race Vintage 2017 (2010-2017) postcensal population estimates (released by NCHS on 6/27/2018).These estimates were prepared by the Census Bureau in collaboration with NCHS.
datadoc.citation.bridge_race: Health Information Gateway, Office on Women's Health, HHS, 5/26/2017.
datadoc.notes.bridge_race: These estimates result from bridging the 31 race categories used in Census 2000, as specified in the 1997 Office of Management and Budget (OMB) standards for the collection of data on race and ethnicity, to the four race categories specified under the 1977 standards (Asian or Pacific Islander, Black or African American, American Indian or Alaska Native, White).
chart.title.measure.std.PrimaryandSecond: Number of Primary and Secondary Syphilis Cases
chart.title.measure.std.EarlyLatentSyphi: Number of Early Latent Syphilis Cases
label.help.text.brfss.topic: Topics addressed in the BRFSS core questionnaire include barriers to and content of prenatal care, obstetric history, maternal use of alcohol and cigarettes, physical abuse, contraception, economic status, maternal stress, and early infant development and health status
label.help.text.brfss.year: This field indicates the Year of the BRFSS survey
label.help.text.brfss.state: This field indicates the States for which BRFSS data is available
label.help.text.brfss.question: This field indicates the questions which were developed and tested and ultimately placed on the BRFSS questionnaire
label.help.text.brfss.sex: This field indicates the sex of the survey respondents
label.help.text.brfss.race_ethnicity: This field indicates the race or ethnicity of the survey respondents
label.help.text.brfss.age_group: This field indicates the age-group of the survey respondents
label.help.text.brfss.education: This field indicates the education attained by the survey respondents
label.help.text.brfss.income: This field indicates the household income of the survey respondents
datadoc.tb.data.filter.restrictions: TB state-level data can be viewed in aggregate format or one-way stratifications (i.e., by Sex, Race/Ethnicity, Age group or Country of birth).
minority.factsheet.definition: This fact sheet displays demographic and health status information for Hispanic individuals of any race and the following non-Hispanic groups: African Americans, American Indians and Alaska Natives, Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders.
fs.hiv.rates.per.hundredK: (rate per 100,000 population aged 13 years and older)
fs.adge-adjusted.rates.def: Age-adjusted death rates are weighted averages of the age-specific death rates, where the weights represent a fixed population of 100,000 by age.
